alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 17 at 8:00PM CDT until March 25 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, MARCH 25... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until Friday, March 25. * IMPACTS...At 369.0 feet, Box Elder Drive is flooding just east of the bridge over Beason Creek. Stadium Drive is flooded at Musselers Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 368.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 368.4 feet and then begin rising just after midnight tonight. It will then rise again to 368.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will fall to 366.3 feet and then begin rising Monday evening. It will then rise again to 366.4 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 365.0 feet. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
